Apple___Apple_scab.advice: Prune infected areas. Apply appropriate fungicides. Ensure good air circulation.

Apple___Black_rot.advice: Remove and destroy infected fruit and dead wood. Prune to improve air circulation. Apply fungicides during susceptible periods.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.advice: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Apply fungicides preventatively.

Apple___healthy.advice: Maintain good orchard hygiene. Monitor regularly for pests and diseases.

Blueberry___healthy.advice: Ensure proper soil pH. Water consistently. Prune annually.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.advice: Improve air circulation through pruning. Apply fungicides at first sign of disease.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.advice: Protect from birds. Ensure adequate watering and fertilization.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray.advice: Practice crop rotation. Use resistant hybrids. Apply fungicides if severe.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.advice: Plant resistant varieties. Fungicides may be needed for susceptible varieties if disease is early and severe.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.advice: Use resistant hybrids. Crop rotation and tillage can reduce inoculum. Apply fungicides when necessary.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.advice: Ensure proper nutrient management and weed control. Monitor for pests.

Grape___Black_rot.advice: Remove and destroy infected berries and mummified fruit. Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).advice: Prune out infected wood well below symptoms. No effective chemical control, focus on cultural practices.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.advice: Improve air circulation. Rake and destroy fallen leaves. Apply fungicides if needed.

Grape___healthy.advice: Proper pruning, trellising, and canopy management are crucial. Monitor for common pests.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).advice: Control psyllid vectors. Remove infected trees promptly. No cure, focus on prevention and management.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).medicine: N/A (Vector control with insecticides like Imidacloprid)

Peach___Bacterial_spot.advice: Plant resistant varieties. Apply copper-based bactericides. Prune for air circulation.

Peach___healthy.advice: Thin fruit for better size and quality. Manage pests like peach tree borer.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.advice: Use disease-free seed and transplants. Rotate crops. Apply copper-based bactericides.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.medicine: Bactericides: Copper-based sprays, Streptomycin (in some areas).

Pepper,_bell___healthy.advice: Provide support for plants. Ensure consistent watering. Monitor for aphids and other pests.

Potato___Early_blight.advice: Rotate crops. Destroy volunteer potato plants. Apply fungicides preventatively.

Potato___Late_blight.advice: Plant resistant varieties. Destroy cull piles. Apply fungicides regularly, especially during cool, wet weather.

Potato___healthy.advice: Ensure proper hilling. Control potato beetles. Harvest carefully to avoid bruising.

Raspberry___healthy.advice: Prune canes after harvest. Manage weeds. Provide support for canes.

Soybean___healthy.advice: Plant at optimal time. Ensure good soil drainage. Monitor for soybean aphids and other pests.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.advice: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Apply fungicides or horticultural oils.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.medicine: Fungicides: Sulfur, Potassium bicarbonate, Myclobutanil, Neem oil.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.advice: Remove infected leaves. Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides if severe.

Strawberry___healthy.advice: Protect from slugs and birds. Renovate beds after harvest. Use straw mulch.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.advice: Use disease-free seed. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply copper-based bactericides.

Tomato___Early_blight.advice: Stake or cage plants. Mulch to reduce soil splash. Apply fungicides preventatively.

Tomato___Late_blight.advice: Plant resistant varieties if available. Destroy infected plants immediately. Apply fungicides regularly during high-risk periods.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.advice: Improve air circulation (especially in greenhouses). Reduce humidity. Use resistant varieties. Apply fungicides.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.advice: Remove and destroy infected lower leaves. Mulch. Rotate crops. Apply fungicides.

Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider.advice: Spray plants with water to dislodge mites. Use insecticidal soaps or horticultural oils. Introduce predatory mites.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider.medicine: Miticides: Abamectin, Spiromesifen, Horticultural oil, Insecticidal soap.

Tomato___Target_Spot.advice: Improve air circulation. Avoid wetting foliage. Apply fungicides.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.advice: Control whitefly vectors. Use reflective mulches. Remove infected plants. Plant resistant varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.medicine: N/A (Vector control with insecticides like Imidacloprid, Pyriproxyfen)

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.advice: Wash hands and tools frequently. Do not use tobacco products around plants. Remove and destroy infected plants. Control weeds.

Tomato___healthy.advice: Provide consistent watering. Fertilize appropriately. Support plants with stakes or cages.
